1.text: Bring a pot of water to a boil to make corn on the cob for a crowd.

2.text: Heat a charcoal or gas grill to high if you want corn with a smoky flavor.
2.vid: /1/1d/Cook Corn on the Cob Step 2 Version 4.360p.mp4

3.text: Preheat your oven to 350 °F (177 °C) for a hands-off cooking method.

4.text: Put 1 ear into the microwave for the fastest way to cook corn.

5.text: Cook up to 8 ears of corn in your pressure cooker.
5.vid: /c/c6/Cook Corn on the Cob Step 5 Version 4.360p.mp4

6.text: Cook tender corn in a skillet to give it a crisp texture.
6.vid: /9/91/Cook Corn on the Cob Step 6 Version 4.360p.mp4

7.text: Heat your classic smoker to 250 °F (121 °C) for corn that has incredible flavor.
7.vid: /3/39/Cook Corn on the Cob Step 7 Version 4.360p.mp4

8.text: Cook corn cobs with their husks in the embers of a fire for a smoky flavor.
8.vid: /5/50/Cook Corn on the Cob Step 8 Version 4.360p.mp4

9.text: Vacuum seal corn on the cob if you want to use your sous vide cooker.
